intro: Chrysophyllum sparsiflorum var. fagifolium, commonly known as the African cherry or fagifolium variant, is a tropical evergreen tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and fruit production. The leaves are typically alternate and can vary in size and shape depending on environmental conditions.
